intro: Pedicularis villosula, commonly known as the hairy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and alpine meadows. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
